title: Archeologist/dNetHack
data:
In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the **Archeologist** is one of the [roles](/wiki/Role "Role") available to the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero").

Archeologists can be of [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") or [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment"), and can be a [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)"), [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"), [clockwork automaton](/wiki/Clockwork_automaton_\(starting_race\) "Clockwork automaton (starting race)"), [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race_in_dNetHack\) "Vampire (starting race in dNetHack)"), or [half-dragon](/wiki/Half-dragon_\(starting_race\) "Half-dragon (starting race)").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
- [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [3 Skills](#Skills)
- [4 Special rules](#Special_rules)
- [5 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
- [6 Gods](#Gods)
- [7 Quest](#Quest)
- [8 Strategy](#Strategy)

## Starting equipment

Each Archeologist starts with the following equipment:

- +2 [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") ([wielded](/wiki/Wielded "Wielded"))
- +0 [jacket](/wiki/Jacket "Jacket")
- +0 [fedora](/wiki/Fedora "Fedora")
- +0 pair of [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots")
- 3 to 6 uncursed [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")
- +1 uncursed [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") (alternate weapon)
- uncursed [tinning kit](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit") (30 to 99 charges)
- uncursed [touchstone](/wiki/Touchstone "Touchstone")
- uncursed [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack")
- 3 to 6 uncursed +0 [torches](/wiki/Torch "Torch")
- uncursed [tin opener](/wiki/Tin_opener "Tin opener")
- uncursed [oil lamp](/wiki/Oil_lamp "Oil lamp")

## Intrinsics

Archeologists gain the following abilities upon reaching the following [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- XL 1: [Stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")
- XL 1: [Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")
- XL 10: [Searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching")

## Skills

Archeologists have the following [skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill") available to them:

| Archeologist skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max                 | [Skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Basic               | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), [farm implements](/index.php?title=Farm_implements\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Farm implements (page does not exist)")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding"), [shields](/wiki/Shield "Shield"), [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat")
- *Spells:* [attack](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells"), [healing](/wiki/Healing_spells "Healing spells"), [matter](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells") |
| Skilled             | * *Weapons:* [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [firearm](/wiki/Firearm "Firearm"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
* *Spells:* [wand damage](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Expert              | - *Weapons:* [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang"), [whip](/wiki/Whip "Whip")
- *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")
- *Spells:* [divination](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

Archeologists start with *Basic* skill level in whips, pick-axes and slings: touchstones are classed as sling [ammunition](/wiki/Ammunition "Ammunition"), and [bug C343-355](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3#Bug_C343-355 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3") is incorporated as a feature. Their [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [magic mapping](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_mapping "Spellbook of magic mapping").

## Special rules

Archeologists can [apply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") uncursed [touchstones](/wiki/Touchstone "Touchstone") as if they were blessed to formally identify any [gem](/wiki/Gem "Gem").

Archeologists suffer a −1 penalty to [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") for breaking a [historic statue](/wiki/Historic_statue "Historic statue").

Non-chaotic archeologists suffer a −3 penalty to alignment record for digging up a [headstone](/wiki/Headstone "Headstone"), while chaotic archeologists get a +3 bonus for doing the game.

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:

- XL 1–2: Digger
- XL 3–5: Field Worker
- XL 6–9: Investigator
- XL 10–13: Exhumer
- XL 14–17: Excavator
- XL 18–21: Spelunker
- XL 22–25: Speleologist
- XL 26–29: Collector
- XL 30: Curator

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

The Archeologist pantheon is based on Central American mythology, specifically the Aztecs. Their first gift is [Xiuhcoatl](/index.php?title=DNetHack_variants\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "DNetHack variants (page does not exist)").

- Lawful: [Quetzalcoatl](/wiki/Quetzalcoatl "Quetzalcoatl")
- Neutral: [Camaxtli](/wiki/Camaxtli "Camaxtli")
- Chaotic: [Huhetotl](/wiki/Huhetotl "Huhetotl")

## Quest

- *Main article: [Archeologist quest/dNetHack](/index.php?title=Archeologist_quest/dNetHack\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archeologist quest/dNetHack (page does not exist)")*

The Archeologist's redesigned [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees them fight [The Minion of Huhetotl](/wiki/The_Minion_of_Huhetotl "The Minion of Huhetotl") for [Itlachiayaque](/wiki/Itlachiayaque_\(dNetHack\) "Itlachiayaque (dNetHack)"), an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [roundshield](/wiki/Roundshield "Roundshield"). While carried, it confers [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage"), and while worn it also grants [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") and [dragonbreath reflection](/wiki/Reflection#dNetHack "Reflection"). [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") Itlachiayaque allows the character to create a mass of [poison clouds](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud"), similar to a [read](/wiki/Read "Read") [scroll of stinking cloud](/wiki/Scroll_of_stinking_cloud "Scroll of stinking cloud").

## Strategy

With the changes to [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon#dNetHack "Twoweapon") in dNetHack, Archeologists are a lot less capable of leaning on the skill to compensate for their lack of offense, and remain one of the harder roles to get off the ground - thankfully, they become proficient spear users due to the skill set changes and their new first gift in Xiuhcoatl, and can also make decent use of [shields](/wiki/Shield "Shield"); their good mental stats can also lend themselves to [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") builds.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Elaborate further on role strategy and its differences from vanilla."*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Archeologist/dNetHack

From NetHackWiki
< Archeologist
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In dNetHack, the Archeologist is one of the roles available to the hero.

Archeologists can be of lawful or neutral alignment, and can be a human, dwarf, gnome, clockwork automaton, vampire, or half-dragon.

Contents

  • 1 Starting equipment
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Skills
  • 4 Special rules
  • 5 Rank titles
  • 6 Gods
  • 7 Quest
  • 8 Strategy

Starting equipment

Each Archeologist starts with the following equipment:

  • +2 bullwhip (wielded)
  • +0 jacket
  • +0 fedora
  • +0 pair of high boots
  • 3 to 6 uncursed food rations
  • +1 uncursed pick-axe (alternate weapon)
  • uncursed tinning kit (30 to 99 charges)
  • uncursed touchstone
  • uncursed sack
  • 3 to 6 uncursed +0 torches
  • uncursed tin opener
  • uncursed oil lamp

Intrinsics

Archeologists gain the following abilities upon reaching the following experience levels:

  • XL 1: Stealth
  • XL 1: Speed
  • XL 10: Searching

Skills

Archeologists have the following skills available to them:

Archeologist skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: dagger, knife, short sword, dart, farm implements
  • Combat: riding, shields, two weapon combat
  • Spells: attack, healing, matter
Skilled
  • Weapons: scimitar, club, quarterstaff, firearm, sling, unicorn horn
  • Spells: wand damage
Expert
  • Weapons: pick-axe, saber, spear, boomerang, whip
  • Combat: bare hands
  • Spells: divination

Archeologists start with Basic skill level in whips, pick-axes and slings: touchstones are classed as sling ammunition, and bug C343-355 is incorporated as a feature. Their special spell is magic mapping.

Special rules

Archeologists can apply uncursed touchstones as if they were blessed to formally identify any gem.

Archeologists suffer a −1 penalty to alignment record for breaking a historic statue.

Non-chaotic archeologists suffer a −3 penalty to alignment record for digging up a headstone, while chaotic archeologists get a +3 bonus for doing the game.

Rank titles

The status line displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:

  • XL 1–2: Digger
  • XL 3–5: Field Worker
  • XL 6–9: Investigator
  • XL 10–13: Exhumer
  • XL 14–17: Excavator
  • XL 18–21: Spelunker
  • XL 22–25: Speleologist
  • XL 26–29: Collector
  • XL 30: Curator

Gods

Main article: Religion

The Archeologist pantheon is based on Central American mythology, specifically the Aztecs. Their first gift is Xiuhcoatl.

  • Lawful: Quetzalcoatl
  • Neutral: Camaxtli
  • Chaotic: Huhetotl

Quest

Main article: Archeologist quest/dNetHack

The Archeologist's redesigned quest sees them fight The Minion of Huhetotl for Itlachiayaque, an artifact roundshield. While carried, it confers magic resistance, telepathy and half spell damage, and while worn it also grants fire resistance and dragonbreath reflection. Invoking Itlachiayaque allows the character to create a mass of poison clouds, similar to a read scroll of stinking cloud.

Strategy

With the changes to twoweaponing in dNetHack, Archeologists are a lot less capable of leaning on the skill to compensate for their lack of offense, and remain one of the harder roles to get off the ground - thankfully, they become proficient spear users due to the skill set changes and their new first gift in Xiuhcoatl, and can also make decent use of shields; their good mental stats can also lend themselves to spellcasting builds.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Elaborate further on role strategy and its differences from vanilla."

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Archeologist/dNetHack&oldid=177627"

In [[dNetHack]], the '''Archeologist''' is one of the [[role]]s available to the [[hero]].

Archeologists can be of [[lawful]] or [[neutral]] [[alignment]], and can be a [[Human (starting race)|human]], [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarf]], [[Gnome (starting race)|gnome]], [[Clockwork automaton (starting race)|clockwork automaton]], [[Vampire (starting race in dNetHack)|vampire]], or [[Half-dragon (starting race)|half-dragon]].

==Starting equipment==
Each Archeologist starts with the following equipment:

* +2 [[bullwhip]] ([[wielded]])
* +0 [[jacket]]
* +0 [[fedora]]
* +0 pair of [[high boots]]
* 3 to 6 uncursed [[food ration]]s
* +1 uncursed [[pick-axe]] (alternate weapon)
* uncursed [[tinning kit]] (30 to 99 charges)
* uncursed [[touchstone]]
* uncursed [[sack]]
* 3 to 6 uncursed +0 [[torch]]es
* uncursed [[tin opener]]
* uncursed [[oil lamp]]

==Intrinsics==
Archeologists gain the following abilities upon reaching the following [[experience level]]s:

*XL 1: [[Stealth]]
*XL 1: [[Speed]]
*XL 10: [[Automatic searching|Searching]]

==Skills==
Archeologists have the following [[skill]]s available to them:

* ''Weapons:'' [[dagger]], [[knife]], [[short sword]], [[dart]], [[farm implements]]

Archeologists start with ''Basic'' skill level in whips, pick-axes and slings: touchstones are classed as sling [[ammunition]], and [[Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3#Bug C343-355|bug C343-355]] is incorporated as a feature. Their [[special spell]] is {{+ of|magic mapping}}.

==Special rules==
Archeologists can [[apply]] uncursed [[touchstone]]s as if they were blessed to formally identify any [[gem]].

Archeologists suffer a −1 penalty to [[alignment record]] for breaking a [[historic statue]].

Non-chaotic archeologists suffer a −3 penalty to alignment record for digging up a [[headstone]], while chaotic archeologists get a +3 bonus for doing the game.

==Rank titles==
The [[status line]] displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:

*XL 1–2: Digger
*XL 3–5: Field Worker
*XL 6–9: Investigator
*XL 10–13: Exhumer
*XL 14–17: Excavator
*XL 18–21: Spelunker
*XL 22–25: Speleologist
*XL 26–29: Collector
*XL 30: Curator

==Gods==
{{main|Religion}}
The Archeologist pantheon is based on Central American mythology, specifically the Aztecs. Their first gift is [[dNetHack variants#Xiuhcoatl|Xiuhcoatl]].

* Lawful:  [[Quetzalcoatl]]
* Neutral: [[Camaxtli]]
* Chaotic: [[Huhetotl]]

==Quest==
{{main|Archeologist quest/dNetHack}}
The Archeologist's redesigned [[quest]] sees them fight [[The Minion of Huhetotl]] for [[Itlachiayaque (dNetHack)|Itlachiayaque]], an [[artifact]] [[roundshield]]. While carried, it confers [[magic resistance]], [[telepathy]] and [[half spell damage]], and while worn it also grants [[fire resistance]] and [[Reflection#dNetHack|dragonbreath reflection]]. [[Invoking]] Itlachiayaque allows the character to create a mass of [[poison cloud]]s, similar to a [[read]] [[scroll of stinking cloud]].

==Strategy==
With the changes to [[Twoweapon#dNetHack|twoweaponing]] in dNetHack, Archeologists are a lot less capable of leaning on the skill to compensate for their lack of offense, and remain one of the harder roles to get off the ground - thankfully, they become proficient spear users due to the skill set changes and their new first gift in Xiuhcoatl, and can also make decent use of [[shield]]s; their good mental stats can also lend themselves to [[spellcasting]] builds.
